name: Getting Zero
statement: Suppose you have an integer $$$v$$$. In one operation, you can: either set $$$v = (v + 1) \bmod 32768$$$ or set $$$v = (2 \cdot v) \bmod 32768$$$. You are given $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \dots, a_n$$$. What is the minimum number of operations you need to make each $$$a_i$$$ equal to $$$0$$$?
inputFormat: The first line contains the single integer $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \le n \le 32768$$$) â€” the number of integers. The second line contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \dots, a_n$$$ ($$$0 \le a_i < 32768$$$).
outputFormat: Print $$$n$$$ integers. The $$$i$$$-th integer should be equal to the minimum number of operations required to make $$$a_i$$$ equal to $$$0$$$.
